column1: The magic spell was in Latin
column2: of course; but the princess knew Latin very well
column3: and soon she had the magic song by heart. Then she closed the book and put it back on the shelf. Then she threw open the window and drew back the curtains and put out all the lights except two scented candles that burned with a white fire under a round mirror with a silver frame
column4: opposite the window. And into that mirror the moon shone white and full
column5: filling all the space of it so that the room was steeped in a strange silver light. Now the whole room seemed to sway gently
column6: waving and trembling; and as it trembled it sounded and rang with a low silver music
column7: as if it were filled with the waves of the sea.Then the princess took a great silver basin
column8: covered with strange black signs and figures raised in the silver. She poured water into the basin
column9: and as she poured it she sang the magic spell from the Latin book.
